description.raw:
This is the first PR of the brew bottle creation integrated into the release.py and implementing the following workflow:

```
 - release.py
 -> update tarball hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater) [not in this PR, already implemented]
    -> build bottle (generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder)
          -> upload bottle to S3 (repository_uploader) 
          -> update bottle hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater)
```
Testing runs:

 * [Bottle builder](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/37/)
 * [Bottle hash update](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/25/)

It currently creates two different pull requests to update hashes. @scpeters mentioned that we will need to commit the second modification in the first pull request open. I've leave this for a next pull request, I still need to figure out how to hack this.
description.html:
This is the first PR of the brew bottle creation integrated into the release.py and implementing the following workflow:

 - release.py
 -> update tarball hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater) [not in this PR, already implemented]
    -> build bottle (generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder)
          -> upload bottle to S3 (repository_uploader) 
          -> update bottle hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater)

Testing runs:

  • Bottle builder
  • Bottle hash update

It currently creates two different pull requests to update hashes. @scpeters mentioned that we will need to commit the second modification in the first pull request open. I've leave this for a next pull request, I still need to figure out how to hack this.
